U.S. Hostile Policy towards DPRK Slammed in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Solidarity and the People's Solidarity of south Korea called a news conference on September 18 on the occasion of the first anniversary of the adoption of the September 19 joint statement on the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula at the fourth round of the six-party talks, according to a press report.
 A press release read out at the conference noted that though one year has passed since the adoption of the joint statement, the discord between the DPRK and the U.S. has grown more acute than ever before, adding that the U.S. is chiefly to blame for this because it has applied sanctions against the north in real earnest defying the agreement reached at the talks and staged ceaseless large-scale war maneuvers to invade the north to realize its strategy for a preemptive nuclear attack.    
 Branding these moves of the U.S. as dangerous provocative acts of gravely threatening the peace on the Korean Peninsula, the press release urged the U.S. to immediately halt the U.S. sanctions against the north and roll back its hostile policy towards north as they run counter to the spirit of the joint statement.

articles.content:
Korean Table-Tennis Players Prove Successful 
   Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Korean table-tennis players proved successful at women's singles event (under 21) of the 2006 Panasonic China "Grand Prix" held in Guangzhou, China from Sept. 14 to 17.
 Kim Jong defeated her rivals by overwhelming scores. She beat the Singaporean rival 4:0 in the semi-finals and the world-strong Austrian competitor 4:3 in the final to take the first place.    
 Meanwhile, Jang Hyon Ae placed third at the same event.

articles.content:
Greetings to Malian President
   Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Amadou Toumani Toure, President and head of state of Mali, on Sept. 19 on the occasion of the 46th anniversary of the promulgation of the Republic of Mali.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue developing favorably in mutual interests, the message wished him greater success in his responsible work for stability of the country and welfare of the people.

articles.title: DPRK Delegations Leave for Spain and Russia
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Armenia
   Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Robert Sedrakovich Kocharyan, President of Armenia, on the 15th national day of Armenia.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on better terms.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Returns Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegations Leave for Spain and Russia
   Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Jang Jae On, chairman of its Central Committee, left Pyongyang Thursday to visit Spain.
 It was seen off at the airport by Vice-Chairman of the Society Central Committee Paek Yong Ho and heads of the delegations of the International Committee of Red Cross and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies working in the DPRK.    
 Meanwhile, a delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Forestry led by Vice-Minister Pak Jae Chun left here by air to attend the 10th forestry sub-committee meeting of the committee for trade, economic, scientific and technological cooperation between the governments of the DPRK and the Russian Federation to be held in Russia.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Returns Home
   Pyongyang, September 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, returned home Thursday after participating in the 14th NAM Summit held in Havana.
 He was greeted at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the SPA Presidium, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and Enrique Montoto Cruz, Cuban charge d'affaires a.i. in Pyongyang.
